TITLE: Supreme Court's overturning of Roe v. Wade will financially hurt the 'most marginalized' women, experts say
SUMMARY: The Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade may cause financial hardship for many women, especially those already facing economic instability.

TITLE: Women prefer values-based investing. Here's what that might mean for their wealth
SUMMARY: Most women prefer investing in a way they think will help the environmental or do social good. Their enthusiasm could help them boost long-term wealth.

TITLE: Tax return backlog is still 'crushing the IRS’ — and taxpayers — as pileup exceeds 21 million, agency watchdog reports
SUMMARY: The IRS backlog of tax returns has swelled to over 21 million, despite efforts to clear the pileup, according to a watchdog report.

TITLE: Tourists are flocking back to Southeast Asia — but the robust recovery is showing signs of cracks
SUMMARY: Southeast Asia is attracting visitors again, but rising costs, hiring troubles and the absence of Chinese tourists may dampen a robust travel recovery.

TITLE: Kevin O’Leary reveals 1 important lesson that every young trader needs to learn
SUMMARY: "When I was a young Buckaroo trader, I used margins and I got slaughtered. And I never did it again," Kevin O'Leary told CNBC's "Squawk Box Asia".

TITLE: Fanatics CEO Michael Rubin selling ownership stake in Philadelphia 76ers, New Jersey Devils
SUMMARY: Fanatics CEO Michael Rubin is selling his ownership stake of the Philadelphia 76ers and New Jersey Devils.

TITLE: Fraud trial against Elizabeth Holmes' partner at Theranos nears end
SUMMARY: Closing arguments in the criminal fraud trial of former Theranos COO Ramesh "Sunny" Balwani kicked off Tuesday.

TITLE: Tax pros ‘very skeptical’ about expanded IRS voice bots for payments plans
SUMMARY: The IRS has expanded artificial intelligence-driven voice bots to tackle payment plans, according to the agency. But tax professionals remain skeptical.

TITLE: Apple CEO Tim Cook recommends this decision-making tactic above all others: 'Your success will be sweetened'
SUMMARY: Tim Cook says he's found a surefire way to lead a fulfilling professional and personal life. It starts with your own morals and values.

TITLE: Estate planning 101: the do’s and don’ts, what to expect to pay and what your options are
SUMMARY: Regardless of age and wealth, virtually everyone should consider how they want their assets distributed upon their death.

TITLE: Many younger baby boomers may outlive their 401(k) savings, new research finds. Here's why
SUMMARY: New research paints worrisome picture for how long 401(k) savings last retirees.

TITLE: Ray Dalio, Bill Gates and Jack Dorsey started their careers before turning 15—now they're all billionaires
SUMMARY: Billionaires Ray Dalio, Bill Gates and Jack Dorsey leveraged the skills they learned as teenagers into influential — and lucrative — careers. Here's how.

TITLE: One key problem has 1 in 4 expats ‘seriously considering’ or ‘planning’ to renounce U.S. citizenship
SUMMARY: Roughly 1 in 4 American expats is “seriously considering” or “planning” to renounce their U.S. citizenship, according to a survey. Here’s the top reason why.

TITLE: Bill Gates says people with high IQs should work for climate-friendly companies: 'Don't just do derivatives on Wall Street'
SUMMARY: Bill Gates says young people with high IQs should prioritizing working on projects with a greater purpose and "not just maximizing income." Here's why.

TITLE: Is the IRS taxing PayPal, Venmo, Zelle, or Cash App transactions? Here's what you need to know
SUMMARY: The IRS has new reporting requirements for Zelle, PayPal, Venmo, and Cash App users. Here's what you need to know if you're on a peer-to-peer payment platform.

TITLE: Dubai’s famous boozy brunches get a reboot as Saturday becomes the new Friday
SUMMARY: After two years of Covid-19 frustration, the emirate’s famous weekend feasts are back with a bang in a new weekend slot — much to the relief of frazzled city dwellers.

TITLE: Amid high inflation, 36% of employees earning $100,000 or more say they are living paycheck to paycheck
SUMMARY: The share of workers earning at least $100,000 a year who report being cash-strapped is double what it was three years ago.

TITLE: Millennial millionaires are delaying home, car purchases due to inflation
SUMMARY: Nearly half of millennial millionaires say higher borrowing costs are causing them to delay buying a car, and 44% say higher interest rates have caused them to delay purchasing a home.

TITLE: Nearly two-thirds of millennial millionaires believe U.S. economy will be stronger by end of 2022, CNBC survey finds
SUMMARY: Most millennial millionaires feel optimistic about the economy, according to the latest CNBC Millionaire Survey.

TITLE: Millionaires are raising cash on fears that the Fed can't tame inflation and stave off recession
SUMMARY: Millionaires surveyed by CNBC ranked inflation as the top risk to both the economy and their personal wealth.

TITLE: 'Nobody's immune to inflation': These are the most expensive cities for the world's wealthy
SUMMARY: A new report shows even the uber wealthy aren't immune to inflationary pressures on their most prized luxury goods.

TITLE: Travelers are upset about rising costs, but most aren't canceling their plans just yet
SUMMARY: The outlook for summer travel remains strong, say industry insiders, with many travelers saying they're concerned but undeterred about their upcoming plans.

TITLE: Here are some tips to stay on track with your retirement and short-term goals amid choppy markets
SUMMARY: A bear market is looming while the Federal Reserve is poised to raise interest rates. Here are the money moves experts say you may want to consider.

TITLE: IRS boosts standard mileage rate deduction to 62.5 cents per mile, a 4 cent hike, as gas soars to more than $5 a gallon
SUMMARY: The IRS will boost the standard mileage rate by 4 cents, to 62.5 cents per mile, starting on July 1. The midyear change is due to soaring gas prices.

TITLE: Despite the bitcoin selloff, it’s still an asset class that is accessible to anyone, says blockchain educator
SUMMARY: CNBC spoke with The Blockchain Foundation's Cleve Mesidor about cryptocurrency's future and how to keep the space from looking like the old world of finance.

TITLE: 228 high-powered CEOs—from Lyft to Bain Capital—are calling for 'bold, urgent action' on gun violence
SUMMARY: High-powered CEOs from a wide range of U.S. companies signed a letter urging Senators to take 'immediate' action on gun violence in America, following multiple mass shootings.

TITLE: Golf vacations to top British courses are selling out this year — and next
SUMMARY: Some of the U.K.'s top golf courses are filling 2023 tee times faster than expected as wealthy Americans return to international travel.

TITLE: Tim Cook expects our behavior to change when we feel 'surveilled all the time' by tech: 'It changes society in a major way'
SUMMARY: Apple's CEO says he thinks people — not tech companies — should own their personal data. Otherwise, tech surveillance could change the way most people behave.

TITLE: Here’s how to fight a higher-than-expected property tax bill
SUMMARY: If the value of your home ballooned during the Covid pandemic, there may be ways to fight a higher-than-expected property tax bill, according to experts.

TITLE: Here's when tax-loss harvesting makes sense ... and when it doesn’t
SUMMARY: It’s possible to trim your tax bill by harvesting investment losses. But the strategy doesn't always make sense, financial experts say.
